Case Management Overview

All support and issues requested by customers through the customer communication channels are logged as cases by the CSRs.

When a CSR is unable to immediately assist the customer during the interaction and requires some follow up to solve the issue, cases are created in Open status.  While creating a case, the CSR specifies the priority, assignee and other vital information of the case for future reference. 

Typically a case is created with details such as communication (phone, social, email ) and reference to the orders.

Even in instances, when a follow up is not required, the CSR resolves the customer issue and creates a case in closed status for better tracking and metrics analytics.

The CSR can perform the following functions:

  • Creating a Case
  • Viewing case details
  • Editing a case
  • Interaction Wrap Up
